front.title: Indicating Character Encoding and Language for HTTP Header Field Parameters

abstract.t: By default, header field values in Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) messages cannot directly carry characters outside the US-ASCII coded character set. RFC 2231 defines an encoding mechanism for use in Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) headers. This document specifies an encoding suitable for use in HTTP header fields that is compatible with a profile of the encoding defined in RFC 2231.
